NAAN BREAD RECIPE

 INGREDIENTS

 Whole wheat flour
 Herbs and spices
 
 PREPARATION

 DOUGH
 In a mixing bowl take ¼ cup fresh curd or yogurt.
 Add 1 teaspoon sugar, 1 teaspoon baking powder and 1 pinch baking soda. 
 With a spoon mix all the ingredients very well till the sugar dissolves.
 Now add 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon salt or add as required in the bowl.
 Make a well in the center and add 2 tablespoons oil. Note that you can even add butter instead of oil.
 Add ¼ to ⅓ cup water or add as required.
 Knead to a smooth and soft dough. 
 Place a moist kitchen towel or napkin completely covering on the dough. Cover the bowl with a lid and let the dough leaven for 2 hours. 

 COOKING
 Make medium-sized balls from the dough.
 Roll to a 6 or 7 inches elongated circle. 
 Heat a heavy griddle or tawa or skillet and keep on medium-high to high heat. Place the naan bread ready on the hot tawa or skillet or griddle. 
 Keep the flame to medium-high or high and begin to cook the naan bread. 
 You have to flip it using tongs and place it directly on the stovetop flame. 
 Place it on a plate or tray. Spread or brush with some softened butter or melted butter.
